entries.name: COMPAT
entries.desc:
A flag for to_s.
Breaks the name returned into multiple lines if longer than 80 characters.

entries.name: DEFAULT_OBJECT_TYPE
entries.desc: The default object type for name entries.

entries.name: MULTILINE
entries.desc:
A flag for to_s.
Returns a multiline format.

entries.name: OBJECT_TYPE_TEMPLATE
entries.desc: The default object type template for name entries.

entries.name: ONELINE
entries.desc:
A flag for to_s.
Returns a more readable format than RFC2253.

entries.name: RFC2253
entries.desc:
A flag for to_s.
Returns an RFC2253 format name.

entries.name: add_entry(oid, value [, type], loc: -1, set: 0) => selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Adds a new entry with the given oid and value to this name.  The oid is an object identifier defined in ASN.1.  Some common OIDs are:

entries.name: eql?(other) → true | falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if name and other refer to the same hash key.

entries.name: hash => integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: The hash value returned is suitable for use as a certificate's filename in a CA path.

entries.name: hash_old => integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an MD5 based hash used in OpenSSL 0.9.X.

entries.name: to_a => [[name, data, type], ...]click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an Array representation of the distinguished name suitable for passing to ::new

entries.name: to_der => stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Converts the name to DER encoding

entries.name: to_utf8 → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an UTF-8 representation of the distinguished name, as specified in RFC 2253.
